10-6-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 10.6: Ensure enhanced representation and voice for developing countries in decision-making in global international economic and financial institutions in order to deliver more effective, credible, accountable and legitimate institutions
10-6-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 10.6.1: Proportion of members and voting rights of developing countries in international organizations
10-6-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: The proportion of members and voting rights of developing countries in international organizations has two components, the developing country proportion of voting rights and the developing country proportion of membership in international organisations. In some institutions these two components are identical.

10-3-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 10: Reduce inequality within and among countries
10-3-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 10.3: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
10-3-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 10.3.1: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
10-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This indicator is defined as the proportion of the population (adults) who self-report that they personally experienced discrimination or harassment during the last 12 months based on ground(s) prohibited by international human rights law. International human rights law refers to the body of international legal instruments aiming to promote and protect human rights, including the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and subsequent international human rights treaties adopted by the United Nations.
10-3-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 10: Reduce inequality within and among countries
10-3-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 10.3: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
10-3-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 10.3.1: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
10-3-1.un_custodian_agency: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR)

15-8-1.page_content:
Non-statistical indicator

We have identified the following to be relevant to this indicator - An invasive alien species strategy for Canada.

fr.page_content:
Indicateur non statistique

Nous avons identifié les éléments suivants comme étant pertinents pour cet indicateur - Une stratégie sur les espèces exotiques envahissantes pour le Canada.
fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 15 : Préserver et restaurer les écosystèmes terrestres, en veillant à les exploiter de façon durable, gérer durablement les forêts, lutter contre la désertification, enrayer et inverser le processus de dégradation des terres et mettre fin à l’appauvrissement de la biodiversité
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 15.8 : Proportion de pays ayant adopté une législation nationale pertinente et allouant des ressources suffisantes à la prévention ou au contrôle des espèces exotiques envahissantes
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 15.8.1 : Proportion de pays ayant adopté une législation nationale pertinente et allouant des ressources suffisantes à la prévention ou au contrôle des espèces exotiques envahissantes

15-8-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 15: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-8-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 15.8: By 2020, introduce measures to prevent the introduction and significantly reduce the impact of invasive alien species on land and water ecosystems and control or eradicate the priority species
15-8-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 15.8.1: Does Canada adopt relevant national legislation for the prevention or control of invasive alien species?
15-8-1.STAT_CONC_DEF:
This indicator aims to quantify trends in:
Commitment by countries to relevant multinational agreements, specifically:
(1) National adoption of invasive alien species relevant policy.
Percentage of countries with:
(a) national legislation and policy relevant to invasive alien species.
(b) targets and objectives within national strategies for preventing and controlling invasive alien species are aligned with Aichi Target 9.
The translation of policy arrangements into action by countries to implement policy and actively prevent and control invasive alien species (IAS) and the resourcing of this action, specifically:
(2) National allocation of resources towards the prevention or control of IAS.
15-8-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 15: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-8-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 15.8: By 2020, introduce measures to prevent the introduction and significantly reduce the impact of invasive alien species on land and water ecosystems and control or eradicate the priority species
15-8-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 15.8.1: Proportion of countries adopting relevant national legislation and adequately resourcing the prevention or control of invasive alien species
15-8-1.un_custodian_agency: International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)

16-10-2.page_content:
Non-statistical indicator

Canada obtained a total score of 7.5 (adoption score: 4.3 + implementation score: 3.2) on the 2023 Survey on Public Access to Information.
We have identified the following to be relevant to this indicator - Access to Information Act.

fr.page_content:
Indicateur non statistique

Canada a obtenu une note totale de 7,5 (note d'adoption: 4,3 + note de mise en œuvre: 3,2) à l’Enquête sur l’accès du public à l’information de 2023.
Nous avons identifié les éléments suivants comme étant pertinents pour cet indicateur - Loi sur l'accès à l'information.
fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 16 : Promouvoir l’avènement de sociétés pacifiques et inclusives aux fins du développement durable, assurer l’accès de tous à la justice et mettre en place, à tous les niveaux, des institutions efficaces, responsables et ouvertes à tous
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 16.10 : Garantir l’accès public à l’information et protéger les libertés fondamentales, conformément à la législation nationale et aux accords internationaux
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 16.10.2 : Nombre de pays qui adoptent et mettent en œuvre des dispositions constitutionnelles, réglementaires et politiques pour garantir l’accès public à l’information

16-10-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-10-2.SDG_TARGET: Target 16.10: Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements
16-10-2.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 16.10.2: Number of countries that adopt and implement constitutional, statutory and/or policy guarantees for public access to information
16-10-2.STAT_CONC_DEF:
Number of countries that adopt and implement constitutional, statutory and/or policy guarantees for public access to information.

The purpose of this indicator is to report the total of number of countries that adopted legal guarantees on access to information (ATI), as well as the main tendencies in the implementation of these guarantees, which are presented in global aggregates.

Based on the definition above, the indicator has two components:
1. Adoption
2. Implementation

Under each component, key questions were identified based on what can be called “Principles of Access to Information”, and which highlight essential components for effective implementation of Access to Information implementation at the country level. These Principles are synthesized from existing frameworks and documents recognised internationally. For the purpose of this survey, the principles of relevance are as follows:

1. Legal frameworks for Access to Information
2. Limited exemptions
3. Oversight mechanism
4. Appeals mechanism
5. Record keeping and reporting

Each question values between 0 and 2. Upon the completion of the survey, a country can get a total score of 0-9. The total score of each country will not be assigned to any level category (e.g.: low, medium or high). However, it will contribute to global aggregates.
16-10-2.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-10-2.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 16.10: Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements
16-10-2.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 16.10.2: Number of countries that adopt and implement constitutional, statutory and/or policy guarantees for public access to information
16-10-2.un_custodian_agency: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization - Institute for Statistics (UNESCO-UIS)

13-3-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 13: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
13-3-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 13.3: Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning
13-3-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 13.3.1: Extent to which (i) global citizenship education and (ii) education for sustainable development are mainstreamed in (a) national education policies; (b) curricula; (c) teacher education; and (d) student assessment
13-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Indicator 4.7.1/12.8.1/13.3.1 measures the extent to which countries mainstream Global Citizenship Education (GCED) and Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) in their education systems. This is an indicator of characteristics of different aspects of education systems: education policies, curricula, teacher training and student assessment as reported by government officials, ideally following consultation with other government ministries, national human rights institutes, the education sector and civil society organizations. It measures what governments intend and not what is implemented in practice in schools and classrooms.

13-3-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 13.3: Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 14 : Conserver et exploiter de manière durable les océans, les mers et les ressources marines aux fins du développement durable
fr.SDG_TARGET:
Cible 14.c : Améliorer la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources en application des dispositions du droit international, 
énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer, qui fournit le cadre juridique requis pour la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans 
et de leurs ressources, comme il est rappelé au paragraphe 158 de « L’avenir que nous voulons »
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 14.c.1 : Nombre de pays progressant dans la ratification, l’acceptation et la mise en œuvre, au moyen de cadres juridiques, opérationnels et institutionnels, des instruments relatifs aux océans visant à donner effet aux dispositions du droit international énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer qui concernent la conservation et de l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources
fr.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Objectif 14 : Conserver et exploiter de manière durable les océans, les mers et les ressources marines aux fins du développement durable

énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer, qui fournit le cadre juridique requis pour la conservation et l’utilisation durable des océans 
et de leurs ressources, comme il est rappelé au paragraphe 158 de « L’avenir que nous voulons »
fr.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicateur 14.c.1 : Nombre de pays progressant dans la ratification, l’acceptation et la mise en œuvre, au moyen de cadres juridiques, opérationnels et institutionnels, des instruments relatifs aux océans visant à donner effet aux dispositions du droit international énoncées dans la Convention des Nations Unies sur le droit de la mer qui concernent la conservation et de l’utilisation durable des océans et de leurs ressources

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 2 : Éliminer la faim, assurer la sécurité alimentaire, améliorer la nutrition et promouvoir l'agriculture durable
fr.SDG_TARGET: Objectif 2.2 : D'ici 2030, mettre fin à toutes formes de malnutrition, notamment en atteignant d'ici 2025 les objectifs convenus au niveau international concernant le retard de croissance et l'émaciation chez les enfants de moins de cinq ans, et répondre aux besoins nutritionnels des adolescentes, des femmes enceintes et allaitantes et des personnes âgées.
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 2.2.2 : Prévalence de la malnutrition (indice poids/taille supérieur à +2 écarts types ou inférieur à -2 écarts types par rapport à la médiane des normes de croissance de l'enfant définies par l'OMS chez les enfants de moins de 5 ans, par forme (surpoids et émaciation)
fr.STAT_CONC_DEF: Prévalence de l'émaciation (poids pour la taille inférieur à -2 écart-type par rapport à la médiane des normes de croissance de l'enfant de l'Organisation mondiale de la santé (OMS)) chez les enfants de moins de 5 ans.
fr.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Objectif 2 : Éliminer la faim, assurer la sécurité alimentaire, améliorer la nutrition et promouvoir l'agriculture durable
fr.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Objectif 2.2 : D'ici 2030, mettre fin à toutes formes de malnutrition, notamment en atteignant d'ici 2025 les objectifs convenus au niveau international concernant le retard de croissance et l'émaciation chez les enfants de moins de cinq ans, et répondre aux besoins nutritionnels des adolescentes, des femmes enceintes et allaitantes et des personnes âgées.
fr.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicateur 2.2.2 : Prévalence de la malnutrition (indice poids/taille supérieur à +2 écarts types ou inférieur à -2 écarts types par rapport à la médiane des normes de croissance de l'enfant définies par l'OMS chez les enfants de moins de 5 ans, par forme (surpoids et émaciation)
fr.un_custodian_agency: Fonds des Nations unies pour l'enfance (UNICEF), Organisation Mondiale de la Santé (OMS)

2-2-2.SDG_GOAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture
2-2-2.SDG_TARGET: Target 2.2: by 2030 end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under five years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and older persons
2-2-2.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 2.2.2: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
2-2-2.STAT_CONC_DEF: Prevalence of wasting (weight for height <-2 standard deviation from the median of the World Health Organization (WHO) Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age.
2-2-2.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture
2-2-2.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 2.2: by 2030 end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under five years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and older persons
2-2-2.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 2.2.2: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 10 : Réduire les inégalités dans les pays et d’un pays à l’autre
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 10.a : Mettre en œuvre le principe d’un traitement spécial et différencié pour les pays en développement, en particulier les pays les moins avancés, conformément aux accords de l’Organisation mondiale du commerce.
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 10.a.1 : Proportion de lignes tarifaires concernées par les importations en provenance des pays les moins avancés et des pays en développement bénéficiant d’une franchise de droits.
fr.STAT_CONC_DEF: Proportion du nombre total de lignes tarifaires (en pourcentage) appliquées aux produits importés des pays les moins avancés et des pays en développement correspondant à un taux de droit de 0 % dans le chapitre 01-97 du SH.
fr.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Objectif 10 : Réduire les inégalités dans les pays et d’un pays à l’autre

fr.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicateur 10.a.1 : Proportion de lignes tarifaires concernées par les importations en provenance des pays les moins avancés et des pays en développement bénéficiant d’une franchise de droits.

16-4-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 16.4: By 2030, significantly reduce illicit financial and arms flows, strengthen the recovery and return of stolen assets and combat all forms of organized crime
16-4-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 16.4.1: Total value of inward and outward illicit financial flows (in current United States dollars)
16-4-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: The indicator measures the total value of inward and outward illicit financial flows (IFFs) in current United States dollars. IFFs are defined as “financial flows that are illicit in origin, transfer or use, that reflect an exchange of value and that cross country borders”.
16-4-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-4-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 16.4: By 2030, significantly reduce illicit financial and arms flows, strengthen the recovery and return of stolen assets and combat all forms of organized crime
16-4-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 16.4.1: Total value of inward and outward illicit financial flows (in current United States dollars)

16-b-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-b-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 16.b: Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development
16-b-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 16.b.1: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
16-b-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This indicator is defined as the proportion of the population (adults) who self-report that they personally experienced discrimination or harassment during the last 12 months based on ground(s) prohibited by international human rights law. International human rights law refers to the body of international legal instruments aiming to promote and protect human rights, including the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and subsequent international human rights treaties adopted by the United Nations.
16-b-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-b-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 16.b: Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development
16-b-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 16.b.1: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 17 : Renforcer les moyens de mettre en œuvre le Partenariat mondial pour le développement durable et le revitaliser
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 17.18 : D’ici à 2020, apporter un soutien accru au renforcement des capacités des pays en développement, notamment des pays les moins avancés et des petits États insulaires en développement, l’objectif étant de disposer d’un beaucoup plus grand nombre de données de qualité, actualisées et exactes, ventilées par niveau de revenu, sexe, âge, race, appartenance ethnique, statut migratoire, handicap et emplacement géographique, et selon d’autres caractéristiques propres à chaque pays
fr.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicateur 17.18.3 : Nombre de pays dotés d’un plan statistique national intégralement financé et en cours de mise en œuvre, par source de financement
fr.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Objectif 17 : Renforcer les moyens de mettre en œuvre le Partenariat mondial pour le développement durable et le revitaliser
fr.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Cible 17.18 : D’ici à 2020, apporter un soutien accru au renforcement des capacités des pays en développement, notamment des pays les moins avancés et des petits États insulaires en développement, l’objectif étant de disposer d’un beaucoup plus grand nombre de données de qualité, actualisées et exactes, ventilées par niveau de revenu, sexe, âge, race, appartenance ethnique, statut migratoire, handicap et emplacement géographique, et selon d’autres caractéristiques propres à chaque pays
fr.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicateur 17.18.3 : Nombre de pays dotés d’un plan statistique national intégralement financé et en cours de mise en œuvre, par source de financement
fr.un_custodian_agency: Partenariat statistique au service du développement au 21e siècle (PARIS21)
fr.goal_meta_link_text: Métadonnées des objectifs de développement durable des Nations Unies

17-18-3.SDG_GOAL: Goal 17: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17-18-3.SDG_TARGET: Target 17.18: By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts
17-18-3.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 17.18.3: Canada's national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation
17-18-3.STAT_CONC_DEF: The indicator "Number of countries with a national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation" is based on the annual Status Report on National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS). In collaboration with its partners, PARIS21 reports on country progress in designing and implementing national statistical plans. The indicator is a count of countries that are either (i) implementing a strategy, (ii) designing one or (iii) awaiting adoption of the strategy in the current year.
17-18-3.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 17: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17-18-3.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 17.18: By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts
17-18-3.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 17.18.3: Number of countries with a national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation, by source of funding
17-18-3.un_custodian_agency: Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21)

fr.SDG_GOAL: Objectif 15 : Préserver et restaurer les écosystèmes terrestres, en veillant à les exploiter de façon durable, gérer durablement les forêts, lutter contre la désertification, enrayer et inverser le processus de dégradation des terres et mettre fin à l’appauvrissement de la biodiversité
fr.SDG_TARGET: Cible 15.6 : Favoriser le partage juste et équitable des bénéfices découlant de l’utilisation des ressources génétiques et promouvoir un accès approprié à celles-ci, ainsi que cela a été décidé à l’échelle internationale

fr.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Cible 15.6 : Favoriser le partage juste et équitable des bénéfices découlant de l’utilisation des ressources génétiques et promouvoir un accès approprié à celles-ci, ainsi que cela a été décidé à l’échelle internationale

15-6-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 15: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-6-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 15.6: Promote fair and equitable sharing of the benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and promote appropriate access to such resources, as internationally agreed
15-6-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 15.6.1: Number of countries that have adopted legislative, administrative and policy frameworks to ensure fair and equitable sharing of benefits
15-6-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: The indicator is defined as the number of countries that have adopted legislative, administrative and policy frameworks to ensure fair and equitable sharing of benefits. It refers to the efforts by countries to implement the Nagoya Protocol on Access to Genetic Resources and the Fair and Equitable Sharing of Benefits Arising from their Utilization to the Convention on Biological Diversity (2010) and the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture (2001).
15-6-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 15: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-6-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 15.6: Promote fair and equitable sharing of the benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and promote appropriate access to such resources, as internationally agreed
15-6-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 15.6.1: Number of countries that have adopted legislative, administrative and policy frameworks to ensure fair and equitable sharing of benefits

17-7-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 17: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development
17-7-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 17.7: Promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound technologies to developing countries on favourable terms, including on concessional and preferential terms, as mutually agreed
17-7-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 17.7.1: Total amount of funding for developing countries to promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound technologies
17-7-1.STAT_CONC_DEF:
The purpose of this indicator is to develop a methodology for tracking the total amount of approved 
funding to promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound 
technologies.
17-7-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 17: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development
17-7-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 17.7: Promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound technologies to developing countries on favourable terms, including on concessional and preferential terms, as mutually agreed
17-7-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 17.7.1: Total amount of funding for developing countries to promote the development, transfer, dissemination and diffusion of environmentally sound technologies
17-7-1.un_custodian_agency: UN Environment (UNEP)-Climate Technology Centre and Network (CTCN)

5-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 5: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5-1-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 5.1: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere
5-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Does Canada have legal frameworks in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non-discrimination on the basis of sex
5-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Indicator 5.1.1 measures government efforts to put in place legal frameworks that promote, enforce and monitor gender equality.
5-1-1.REC_USE_LIM: This is a proxy indicator. Rather than measuring "Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non-discrimination on the basis of sex" as specified in the metadata, this proxy indicator measures the following "Does Canada have legal frameworks in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non-discrimination on the basis of sex.

16-a-1.SDG_GOAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-a-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 16.a: Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime
16-a-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 16.a.1: Existence of independent national human rights institutions in compliance with the Paris Principles
16-a-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: This indicator Existence of independent national human rights institutions in compliance with the Paris Principles measures the compliance of existing national human rights institutions with the Principles relating to the Status of National Institutions (The Paris Principles), which were adopted by the General Assembly (resolution 48/134) based on the rules of procedure of the Global Alliance of National Human Rights Institutions (GANHRI, formerly the International Coordinating Committee of National Institutions for the Promotion and Protection of Human Rights or ICC).
16-a-1.SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-a-1.SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 16.a: Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime
16-a-1.SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 16.a.1: Existence of independent national human rights institutions in compliance with the Paris Principles
16-a-1.un_custodian_agency: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR)
